remote-host.help:
Look up the remote (requesting) host or address.

Arguments:
Return:
The host or address of the caller.

child-added.help:
Signal is emitted when a new object has been added.

Arguments:
child: The name of the added child object.

child-removed.help:
Signal is emitted when an object was removed.

Arguments:
child: The name of the removed child object.

run.help:
Perform a personal calibration.

Return:
true if calibration succeeded, false otherwise.

emit-markers.help:
Emit markers for 3 seconds.

Return:
true if emission of markers was started.

marker.help:
Send out calibration markers when found.

Arguments:
timestamp: The calibration marker timestamp.
position3D: The 3D position of the marker.
position2D: The normalized 2D position of the marker.

child-added.help:
Signal is emitted when a new object has been added.

Arguments:
child: The name of the added child object.

child-removed.help:
Signal is emitted when an object was removed.

Arguments:
child: The name of the removed child object.

child-added.help:
Signal is emitted when a new object has been added.

Arguments:
child: The name of the added child object.

child-removed.help:
Signal is emitted when an object was removed.

Arguments:
child: The name of the removed child object.

domain.help: The domain registered for this host.

port.help: The port registered for this host.

hostname.help: The hostname registered for this host.

domain.help: The domain registered for this host.

port.help: The port registered for this host.

hostname.help: The hostname registered for this host.

wifi-hw-enabled.help: Check the state of the Wi-Fi hardware.

child-added.help:
Signal is emitted when a new object has been added.

Arguments:
child: The name of the added child object.

child-removed.help:
Signal is emitted when an object was removed.

Arguments:
child: The name of the removed child object.

state.help: The current state of the device.

state-reason.help: The reason for the current state of the device.

auto-connect.help: If automatic activation should be performed.

active-configuration.help: The UUID of the active configuration, null if not active.

connected-network.help: The name of the current network.

create-config.help:
Create a configuration for this device.

Arguments:
name: The name of the configuration.
Return:
The UUID of the new configuration, null on error.

connect.help:
Connect device using specific configuration.

Arguments:
uuid: UUID of the configuration to use.
Return:
true on success, false otherwise.

connected.help: Emitted when the active connection changes (connection, disconnection).

state-change.help:
Emitted when the network device state is changed.

Arguments:
state: The new state of the device.
reason: The reason for the new state change.

child-added.help:
Signal is emitted when a new object has been added.

Arguments:
child: The name of the added child object.

child-removed.help:
Signal is emitted when an object was removed.

Arguments:
child: The name of the removed child object.

find-by-id.help:
Find configurations with a matching id.

Arguments:
id: The name of the id to search for.
Return:
Array of configuration UUIDs with matching id.

child-added.help:
Signal is emitted when a new object has been added.

Arguments:
child: The name of the added child object.

child-removed.help:
Signal is emitted when an object was removed.

Arguments:
child: The name of the removed child object.

default.help: If the configuration is a default, read-only, configuration.

dhcp-server-range-low.help: The start of the leased ip range (NULL to auto-select).

dhcp-server-range-high.help: The end of the leased ip range (NULL to auto-select).

dhcp-server-lease-time.help: The time, in hours, for a dhcp lease (0 to auto-select).

save.help:
Save any changed settings in the configuration.

Return:
true if the changes were saved, false otherwise.

delete.help:
Delete configuration.

Return:
true if the configuration was deleted, false otherwise.

state.help: The current state of the device.

state-reason.help: The reason for the current state of the device.

auto-connect.help: If automatic activation should be performed.

active-configuration.help: The UUID of the active configuration, null if not active.

connected-network.help: The name of the current network.

connect-network.help:
Connect to a Network, creating a new configuration if needed.
To reuse the pre-shared key, or to connect to an open network, supply NULL as the PSK argument.

Arguments:
uuid: The UUID of the access point to connect to.
psk: Pre-shared key to use for connection.
Return:
true if the connection succeeded, false otherwise.

scan.help:
Start a scan for Wi-Fi access points.

Return:
true if scan was started, false otherwise.

create-config.help:
Create a configuration for this device.

Arguments:
name: The name of the configuration.
Return:
The UUID of the new configuration, null on error.

connect.help:
Connect device using specific configuration.

Arguments:
uuid: UUID of the configuration to use.
Return:
true on success, false otherwise.

connected.help: Emitted when the active connection changes (connection, disconnection).

state-change.help:
Emitted when the network device state is changed.

Arguments:
state: The new state of the device.
reason: The reason for the new state change.

child-added.help:
Signal is emitted when a new object has been added.

Arguments:
child: The name of the added child object.

child-removed.help:
Signal is emitted when an object was removed.

Arguments:
child: The name of the removed child object.

find-by-id.help:
Find configurations with a matching id.

Arguments:
id: The name of the id to search for.
Return:
Array of configuration UUIDs with matching id.

child-added.help:
Signal is emitted when a new object has been added.

Arguments:
child: The name of the added child object.

child-removed.help:
Signal is emitted when an object was removed.

Arguments:
child: The name of the removed child object.

default.help: If the configuration is a default, read-only, configuration.

dhcp-server-range-low.help: The start of the leased ip range (NULL to auto-select).

dhcp-server-range-high.help: The end of the leased ip range (NULL to auto-select).

dhcp-server-lease-time.help: The time, in hours, for a dhcp lease (0 to auto-select).

access-point.help: If the network should act as an access point.

ssid.help: The SSID of the configured network.

ssid-name.help:
The SSID of the configured network as a string.
Wi-Fi SSIDs are byte arrays, they are _not_ strings, so may contain embedded NULLs and other unprintable characters. This property only be used for debugging and display only.

save.help:
Save any changed settings in the configuration.

Return:
true if the changes were saved, false otherwise.

delete.help:
Delete configuration.

Return:
true if the configuration was deleted, false otherwise.

find-by-ssid.help:
Find networks with a matching SSID.
Filter the list of networks by ssid.

Arguments:
ssid: Base64 encoded SSID to search for.
Return:
Array of UUIDs with matching SSID

child-added.help:
Signal is emitted when a new object has been added.

Arguments:
child: The name of the added child object.

child-removed.help:
Signal is emitted when an object was removed.

Arguments:
child: The name of the removed child object.

visible-name.help: The visible name of a new or ongoing recording.

duration.help: The current duration of an ongoing recording.

created.help: The creation time of the recording.

folder.help: The name of the folder that holds the recording.

gaze-samples.help: The total number of gaze samples in the recording (-1 if not found).

valid-gaze-samples.help: The number of valid gaze samples in the recording (-1 if not found).

gaze-overlay.help: If the recording was started with Gaze Overlay.

uuid.help: Get the UUID of an ongoing recording (null if not ongoing).

remaining-time.help: The approximate number of seconds left for a recording.

start.help:
Create and start a new recording.
If action returns false, action-error is set.

Arguments:
Return:
true if recording could be started, false otherwise.

stop.help:
Stop and save an ongoing recording.

Return:
true if stopping succeeded, false otherwise.

cancel.help: Cancel and delete an ongoing recording.

snapshot.help:
Store a snapshot JPEG image of the current scene.

Return:
true if snapshot was started, false otherwise

send-event.help:
Send event to recording.
Recording must be running to send events.

Arguments:
tag: Tag name of the event.
object: Object data for the event.
Return:
true if event was sent, otherwise false

meta-insert.help:
Insert a key-value pair into the meta data.

Arguments:
key: Name of meta object.
meta: Value base64 meta data, supply null to remove key.
Return:
true if the key-value pair was inserted, false otherwise.

meta-lookup.help:
Get the meta data associated with the specific key.

Arguments:
key: The name of meta object.
Return:
Base64 meta data, null if not found.

meta-keys.help:
Get an array of available meta data keys.

Return:
Array of meta data keys.

started.help:
Signal emitted when a recording is started.

Arguments:
uuid: The UUID that is associated with the started recording.

stopped.help:
Signal emitted when a recording is completed.

Arguments:
folder: The folder the recording was stored in, null on cancel or error.

delete.help:
Delete recording by UUID.
This only marks the recording for deletion and removes it from the list of recordings, the recording is deleted when the last viewer has closed the connection to the recording (see deleted signal).

Arguments:
uuid: The UUID of the recording to delete.
Return:
true if recording was marked for deletion, false otherwise.

scan-done.help:
Emitted at the end of a complete scan of the SD card.
See scan-start.

scan-start.help:
Emitted at start of a complete scan of the SD card.
This usually happens after the card has been inserted or during startup.

deleted.help:
Emitted when a recording has been deleted.
Recordings are deleted when it has been marked for deletion by the delete action and the last viewer has closed the recording.

Arguments:
uuid: The UUID of the recording that was deleted.

child-added.help:
Signal is emitted when a new object has been added.

Arguments:
child: The name of the added child object.

child-removed.help:
Signal is emitted when an object was removed.

Arguments:
child: The name of the removed child object.

visible-name.help: The visible name of a new or ongoing recording.

duration.help: The current duration of an ongoing recording.

created.help: The creation time of the recording.

gaze-samples.help: The total number of gaze samples in the recording (-1 if not found).

valid-gaze-samples.help: The number of valid gaze samples in the recording (-1 if not found).

gaze-overlay.help: If the recording was started with Gaze Overlay.

http-path.help: Get the HTTP path to the recording.

rtsp-path.help: Get the RTSP path to the recording.

move.help:
Move recording to a new location on the SD card.

Arguments:
folder: The new folder name to move to.
Return:
true if the recording was moved, false otherwise.

meta-insert.help:
Insert a key-value pair into the meta data.

Arguments:
key: Name of meta object.
meta: Value base64 meta data, supply null to remove key.
Return:
true if the key-value pair was inserted, false otherwise.

meta-lookup.help:
Get the meta data associated with the specific key.

Arguments:
key: The name of meta object.
Return:
Base64 meta data, null if not found.

meta-keys.help:
Get an array of available meta data keys.

Return:
Array of meta data keys.

scene-scale.help: The scale factor for scene camera images.

scene-quality.help: The JPEG quality for scene camera images.

sync-port-sample.help: Get the latest sync port sample.

keepalive.help:
Start and keep Rudimentary streams alive.
Ensure signal emission for 6 seconds.

Return:
true if signal emission will take place, false otherwise.

send-event.help:
Send an event.
Note; Streams must be started with keep alive signal to be able to send events.

Arguments:
tag: Tag for the event.
object: Object data for the event.
Return:
true on success, false otherwise.

calibrate.help:
Perform a personal calibration.

Return:
true if the calibration succeeded, false otherwise.

event.help:
Emits event objects.

Arguments:
timestamp: The timestamp in seconds.
object: The supplied object.

scene.help:
Emits down-scaled JPEG images from the scene camera.
This is a heavy task by the recording unit and will greatly reduce battery time and processing time for gaze data. Use only if absolutely needed.

Arguments:
timestamp: The timestamp in seconds.
image: Base64 encoded JPEG image.

gaze.help:
Emits gaze objects.

Arguments:
timestamp: The timestamp in seconds.
object: The supplied object.

sync-port.help:
Emits sync port objects.

Arguments:
timestamp: The timestamp in seconds.
object: The supplied object.

imu.help:
Emits IMU sample objects.

Arguments:
timestamp: The timestamp in seconds.
object: The supplied object.

gaze-frequency.help: Selected gaze frequency for the Recording Unit.

gaze-overlay.help: Select to draw gaze marker on the scene-camera video.

changed.help:
Emitted after a settings property is changed.

Arguments:
property: The name of the property that was changed.

version.help: The current version of the recording unit firmware.

recording-unit-serial.help: The serial number of the recording unit (null if not detected).

head-unit-serial.help: The serial number of the head unit.

time.help: The system time of the recording unit in ISO 8601 format.

timezone.help: The time zone of the recording unit.

ntp-is-enabled.help: true if NTP is enabled, false otherwise.

ntp-is-synchronized.help: true if the system clock is synchronized by NTP, false otherwise.

set-time.help:
Set the system time of the recording unit.

Arguments:
time: An ISO 8601 formatted time string.
Return:
true if the system time was set, false otherwise.

set-timezone.help:
Set the system timezone of the recording unit.

Arguments:
timezone: A valid ISO 8601 timezone string.
Return:
true if the timezone was set, false otherwise.

use-ntp.help:
Set NTP synchronization usage.

Arguments:
use: true to switch NTP on, otherwise false.
Return:
true if the NTP state was set, false otherwise.

available-gaze-frequencies.help:
Read the available gaze frequencies from the Head Unit.

Return:
Integer array of available gaze frequencies

child-added.help:
Signal is emitted when a new object has been added.

Arguments:
child: The name of the added child object.

child-removed.help:
Signal is emitted when an object was removed.

Arguments:
child: The name of the removed child object.

remaining-time.help: The remaining battery time in seconds.

state-changed.help:
Signal emitted when the battery state has changed.

Arguments:
state: The new battery state.
charging: true if the charger is connected, false otherwise.

connection-state-changed.help:
Signal emitted when the head unit connection state has changed.

Arguments:
connection-state: The new head unit connection state.

run.help:
Run self tests.

Return:
true if self tests were started, false otherwise

done.help:
Signal emitted when the hwtests are done.

Arguments:
statuscode: 0 if successful, >0 otherwise

free.help: The available free space in bytes of the inserted SD card.

size.help: The size in bytes of the inserted SD card.

remaining-time.help: The approximate number of seconds until there is no space left on the SD card if the recording unit is recording.

space-state.help: Recording availability on the inserted SD card.

card-state.help: The detected partition of the inserted SD card.

busy.help:
If true the recording unit is utilizing the SD card.
User may only remove the SD card when this property is false.

state-changed.help:
Signal emitted after card or space state has changed.

Arguments:
space-state: The new space state.
card-state: The new state of the SD card.

busy-changed.help:
Signal emitted to indicate usage of the SD card.

Arguments:
busy: New busy state.

in-progress.help: true if upgrade is in progress, false otherwise.

progress.help:
Progress reporter for upgrade.

Arguments:
upload: Upload progress.
upgrade: Upgrade progress.

completed.help:
Upgrade completion signal.

Arguments:
success: true if upgrade succeeded, false otherwise.

delete.help:
Delete a WebRTC instance.

Arguments:
uuid: The UUID of the WebRTC instance to delete
Return:
true on success, false otherwise.

create.help:
Create a new WebRTC live instance.

Return:
The UUID of the new live instance on success, null on failure.

play.help:
Create a new WebRTC replay instance.

Arguments:
uuid: The UUID of the recording to replay.
Return:
The UUID of the new replay instance on success, null on failure.

child-added.help:
Signal is emitted when a new object has been added.

Arguments:
child: The name of the added child object.

child-removed.help:
Signal is emitted when an object was removed.

Arguments:
child: The name of the removed child object.

iframe-stream.help: If the supplied stream should only use iframes to lower bitrate.

send-event.help:
Send an event to the running WebRTC session.

Arguments:
tag: The name of the event.
object: JSON Object data for the event.
Return:
true if the event was sent, false otherwise.

start.help:
Start the WebRTC session using the supplied SDP offer from the client.

Arguments:
sdp: The client SDP to use for streaming.
Return:
true if the session was started, false on error.

keepalive.help:
Should be called with a set interval to keep the session alive.
If not called, the WebRTC session will timeout after 20 seconds.

setup.help:
Setup the WebRTC system and generate an SDP offer.

Arguments:
Return:
The RU SDP offer.

add-ice-candidate.help:
Add a remote ICE candidate to the session.

Arguments:
id: The ICE ID.
candidate: The ICE candidate definition.

get-ice-candidates.help:
Returns the collected list of ICE candidates.
The list is then cleared between calls. 
This option may be used instead of the "new-ice-candidate" signal.

Return:
A JSON array of candidates

event.help:
Emits event objects on event messages.

Arguments:
timestamp: The timestamp in seconds.
object: The object for the signal.

gaze.help:
Emits gaze point objects.

Arguments:
timestamp: The timestamp in seconds.
object: The object for the signal.

sync-port.help:
Emits sync port objects.

Arguments:
timestamp: The timestamp in seconds.
object: The object for the signal.

imu.help:
Emits IMU objects.
Note; these come in chunks.

Arguments:
timestamp: The timestamp in seconds.
object: The object for the signal.

timed-out.help: Emitted once the WebRTC session has timed out.

new-ice-candidate.help:
Emitted on new ICE candidates.

Arguments:
id: The ID of the ICE candidate.
candidate: The ICE candidate definition.
